Hollyweird next up death does not have

Living Dead scientists at Duke
University in North Carolina have
conducted an odd experiment with a dead
swamp sparrow the boffins added a tiny
linear motor and a microchip to the
carcass so they could make its wings
flap attaching it to a branch in the
wild they could then study if the
deceased birdies flapping encouraged
male aggressive behavior among the
species they've called it Robo Sparrow
Blade Runner here we come cyborg swamps
perros smackdown thanks science men
creates Robo Sparrow Robo Sparrow
provokes aggression in Birds Robo
Sparrow is destroyed and balances
restored yes the two-month experiment
came to an abrupt end after Robo Sparrow
was attacked several times by other
males so much so that his wings stopped
flapping and his little head fell off
finally everyone has favorite songs but
how about hearing those tunes over and
over inside your head forever well
that's just what's happening to english
school cleaner Susan root the 63-year
old suffers from a rare form of tinnitus
called musical hallucination songs like
God Save the Queen and happy birthday
play on repeat inside her head but it is
the novelty 50s hit how much is that
doggie in the window that is getting the
most airplay inside Susan's cranium what
fresh hell is this this is fine
